summary: Antonio Veciana was the founder of Alpha 66, an anti-Castro Cuban exile group. He is of interest to the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence (SSCI) and the House Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA) in relation to inquiries into the assassinations of President John F. Kennedy and Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. Veciana's connections to Cuban intelligence networks and U.S. agencies are being investigated. The NSA has been requested to provide information on Veciana, including Cuban material from 1961-1965. Veciana is also connected to William Gaudet, and his biographical information is being traced by the CIA. The documents suggest a focus on Veciana's activities and associations, particularly concerning Cuban matters and potential assassination plans.
significance: Antonio Veciana's significance in the JFK context lies in his potential connections to Cuban intelligence networks and his role as the founder of Alpha 66, an anti-Castro group. The SSCI and HSCA are interested in his activities and associations, particularly concerning any involvement in assassination plots or knowledge of events related to the JFK assassination.
